pullRequest.title: Clean up GitHub Actions scripts
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR does clean up the Pioneer GitHub Actions scripts by several means:

Avoid unshallow fetch during release since Sonar is not involved and, therefore, full history is not needed.
Do unshallow fetch during build via new actions/checkout option.
Consistently name steps, jobs, workflows (using sentence case) and the corresponding files (using kebab case).

Proposed commit message:
Clean up GitHub Actions scripts (#316)

* Avoid unshallow fetch during release since Sonar is not involved
and, therefore, full history is not needed.
* Do unshallow fetch during build via new `actions/checkout` option.
* Consistently name steps, jobs, workflows (using sentence case) and
the corresponding files (using kebab case).


PR checklist
The following checklist shall help the PR's author, the reviewers and maintainers to ensure the quality of this project.
It is based on our contributors guidelines, especially the "writing code" section.
It shall help to check for completion of the listed points.
If a point does not apply to the given PR's changes, the corresponding entry can be simply marked as done.
Documentation (general)

 There is documentation (Javadoc and site documentation; added or updated)
 There is implementation information to describe why a non-obvious source code / solution got implemented
 Site documentation has its own .adoc file in the docs folder, e.g. docs/report-entries.adoc
 Only one sentence per line (especially in .adoc files)
 Javadoc uses formal style, while sites documentation may use informal style (see #265)

Documentation (new extension)

 The docs/docs-nav.yml navigation has an entry for the new extension
 The package-info.java contains information about the new extension

Code

 Code adheres to code style, naming conventions etc.
 Successful tests cover all changes
 There are checks which validate correct / false usage / configuration of a functionality and there are tests to verify those checks (see #164)
 Tests use AssertJ or our own PioneerAssert (which are based on AssertJ)

Contributing

 A prepared commit message exists
 The list of contributions inside README.md mentions the new contribution (real name optional)


I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Pioneer Contributor License Agreement.

commit.message:
Don't fetch unshallow during release

No Sonar, no need for full history.

Use new checkout option to fetch unshallow

Should have the same effect: https://github.com/actions/checkout#fetch-all-history-for-all-tags-and-branches

Name workflows consistently

And remove default comments.

nodes.bodyText: i want to start a discussion here, i think this build is redundant as it is part of the name of the action, and i think it has a nice reading in the gui without it. I just want to check in what you think about - but that was my initial thought when i removed it.
